categories_expenses.ai_summary: Your total income for January was $8,500, and your total spending was $2,729.99, which is 32.12% of your income. In February, your total income was $8,500, and your total spending was $4,432.22, which is 52.14% of your income. Your largest expenses were rent ($2,500), car payment ($350), and groceries ($125.75). You spent a reasonable amount on entertainment ($195.97) and dining out ($185.50). To optimize your budget, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment and dining out. Additionally, explore options to lower your housing and transportation costs. Allocate a portion of your remaining income towards your goal of saving for your children's education.
